[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [General: Information Disclosure] Do error messages across all functions consistently avoid leaking sensitive information like validator IPs, account balances, transaction details, or internal state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [General: Error Amplification] Can attackers trigger cascading errors by crafting inputs that generate many Error objects, potentially exhausting memory or causing DoS through error accumulation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [General: Serialization] Does the Serialize implementation handle all edge cases safely, or can malformed Error structs cause serialization panics or produce invalid JSON? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [General: Deserialization] Can malicious JSON payloads exploit the Deserialize implementation to create Error objects that bypass validation or contain inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Integration: API Layer] Can error responses from this module be exploited by clients to infer timing information about transaction processing, consensus state, or validator activity? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Integration: Logging] Are error messages from this module properly sanitized before being logged, or can log injection attacks via malicious error messages corrupt audit logs or bypass log monitoring? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Integration: Monitoring] Can attackers trigger specific error patterns to evade monitoring systems or generate false positives that hide real attacks among noise? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Integration: Client Applications] Do error responses provide enough information for legitimate clients while avoiding excessive detail that aids attackers in reconnaissance or exploitation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Struct: Error] [Clone Safety] Does the Clone trait implementation handle all fields safely, or can cloning Error objects with large messages or complex ledger versions cause performance issues or memory exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Struct: Error] [PartialEq/Eq] Are the PartialEq and Eq implementations secure, or can attackers craft Error objects that compare equal despite having different security implications? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Struct: Error] [Debug Trait] Does the Debug trait expose more information than Display, potentially leaking internal state when errors are debug-printed in development or test environments? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Field: aptos_ledger_version] [Skip Serialization] Does the skip_serializing_if attribute properly handle None values, or can attackers exploit the serialization logic to infer whether ledger version information is available? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Field: code] [Type Safety] Is the u16 type for code sufficient, or should it use a newtype pattern to prevent accidental mixing with other u16 values and ensure type safety? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Field: message] [String Encoding] Does the String type for message properly handle all Unicode encodings, or can invalid UTF-8 sequences cause errors or security issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: status_code()] [Non-Standard Codes] Can custom or non-standard HTTP status codes be represented correctly, or does the from_u16() conversion fail for codes outside the standard range? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: status_code()] [Error Code Confusion] Can the fallback to 500 error mask specific client errors, making it harder to distinguish between server failures and client mistakes in monitoring and debugging? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [General: Resource Limits] Are there any limits on the number of Error objects that can be created, or can attackers exhaust memory by triggering massive numbers of errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [General: String Size] Is there a maximum length for error message strings, or can unbounded messages cause memory exhaustion when errors are accumulated or serialized? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: not_found()] [Format Macro Safety] Does the format! macro properly escape the resource and identifier parameters, or can special characters cause formatting issues or injection attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: invalid_param()] [Format Specifiers] Can format specifiers like {} or {:?} in parameter names or values cause unintended formatting behavior or information disclosure? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: invalid_request_body()] [Nested Formatting] Can nested format! calls in error creation lead to performance issues or unexpected behavior with complex error messages? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: aptos_ledger_version()] [Versioning Oracle] Can attackers use ledger version information in errors to perform oracle attacks, determining exactly when transactions are committed or state changes occur? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: not_found()] [State Inference] Can the combination of 404 errors with specific ledger versions allow attackers to build a timeline of when resources appear or disappear from blockchain state? (Low)
